subject: Nutrition
title: Anti-Inflammatory Foods for Recovery
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Anti-Inflammatory Foods for Recovery.

hook.text: Exercise creates inflammation for adaptation. But too much of it slows recovery significantly.

buildup.text: Omega-3s from fish, walnuts, and flaxseed reduce exercise-induced inflammation naturally.

discovery.text: Tart cherry juice cuts muscle soreness by 13% and speeds strength recovery after intense exercise.

twist.text: Anti-inflammatory drugs like ibuprofen block muscle adaptation. Food-based approaches don't.

climax.text: The right recovery foods reduce inflammation without blunting the training response that drugs disrupt.

punchline.text: Food fights inflammation without blocking muscle growth.

quiz.question: Why are NSAIDs like ibuprofen bad for athletes?
